publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3448 Mr Kenneth Macintosh: Death of Yoni Jesner—That the Parliament expresses horror at the death of 19-year-old Yoni Jesner from Giffnock in East Renfrewshire at the hands of a suicide bomber in a public street in Tel Aviv on 19 September 2002; acknowledges the impact of this atrocity on the Jewish community here in Scotland; believes there can be no justification for such an appalling act; wishes to express its sympathy to Yoni's family and friends; is greatly moved by the donation of Yoni's liver and other organs, which have been used to save the life of a young Palestinian child, and believes that such a practical and symbolic gesture demonstrates the power of tolerance, friendship and common humanity over hate and violence.Supported by: Michael Matheson*, Margaret Jamieson*, David Mundell*

S1M-3448 Death of Yoni Jesner (lodged on 1 October 2002) Nora Radcliffe*, Fiona McLeod*, Mr Alasdair Morrison*, Mr Murray Tosh*, Mr John Home Robertson*, Murdo Fraser*, John Young*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Robert Brown*, Michael Russell*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Bill Aitken*, Mr Andrew Welsh*, Phil Gallie*, Mr Tom McCabe*, Karen Gillon*, Mr Brian Monteith*

*S1M-3448 Mr Kenneth Macintosh: Death of Yoni Jesner—That the Parliament expresses horror at the death of 19-year-old Yoni Jesner from Giffnock in East Renfrewshire at the hands of a suicide bomber in a public street in Tel Aviv on 19 September 2002; acknowledges the impact of this atrocity on the Jewish community here in Scotland; believes there can be no justification for such an appalling act; wishes to express its sympathy to Yoni's family and friends; is greatly moved by the donation of Yoni's *kidneys* and other organs, which have been used to save the life of a young Palestinian child, and believes that such a practical and symbolic gesture demonstrates the power of tolerance, friendship and common humanity over hate and violence.Supported by: Trish Godman*, Des McNulty*, Brian Adam*, Karen Whitefield*, Mr Keith Harding*

S1M-3448 Mr Kenneth Macintosh: Death of Yoni Jesner—That the Parliament expresses horror at the death of 19-year-old Yoni Jesner from Giffnock in East Renfrewshire at the hands of a suicide bomber in a public street in Tel Aviv on 19 September 2002; acknowledges the impact of this atrocity on the Jewish community here in Scotland; believes there can be no justification for such an appalling act; wishes to express its sympathy to Yoni's family and friends; is greatly moved by the donation of Yoni's kidneys and other organs, which have been used to save the life of a young Palestinian child, and believes that such a practical and symbolic gesture demonstrates the power of tolerance, friendship and common humanity over hate and violence.Supported by: Michael Matheson, Margaret Jamieson, David Mundell, Nora Radcliffe, Fiona McLeod, Mr Alasdair Morrison, Mr Murray Tosh, Mr John Home Robertson, Murdo Fraser, John Young, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Robert Brown, Michael Russell, Mr Jamie Stone, Bill Aitken, Mr Andrew Welsh, Phil Gallie, Mr Tom McCabe, Karen Gillon, Mr Brian Monteith, Trish Godman, Des McNulty, Brian Adam, Karen Whitefield, Mr Keith Harding, Brian Fitzpatrick*
S1M-3448 Death of Yoni Jesner (lodged on 1 October 2002) Mr Michael McMahon*, Alex Neil*
S1M-3448 Death of Yoni Jesner (lodged on 1 October 2002) Johann Lamont*, Mr David Davidson*, Sarah Boyack*, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-3448 Death of Yoni Jesner (lodged on 1 October 2002) Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-3448 Death of Yoni Jesner (lodged on 1 October 2002) Irene Oldfather*
S1M-3448 Death of Yoni Jesner (lodged on 1 October 2002) Ian Jenkins*
S1M-3448 Death of Yoni Jesner (lodged on 1 October 2002) Mr Gil Paterson*
S1M-3448 Death of Yoni Jesner (lodged on 1 October 2002) Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*
